children.subject: Yes, if your swap is processed after the deadline, you would be charged. I believe you would be charged for BOTH a drop and add since both actions happen. Students should be receiving an email soon with these enrollment deadlines. Please see that email for more details.
Thanks! And how much is the late fee if I may ask?
I believe it's $10 per drop/add, but I'm not 100% sure. Hopefully someone else can verify.

If I have an ongoing swap request that doesn't get approved until after 9/4 (the drop deadline without late fee), will I get charged a late fee if the class gets dropped? If so how much is the late fee? Thanks.

The swap is only for changing one class with another, e.g. you're enrolled in EECS 16A but you swap for CS61A. If you're enrolled in a class and want to change discussions/labs, you use the option function and not the swap. Just make sure with the options function that you are selecting a discussion/lab that is open. Otherwise, choosing a full section will drop you to the waitlist.
Does the swap deadline also apply to swapping associated sections (i.e. lab or discussion) within a class, if it is managed in CalCentral?

If you don't want to be in Math 54 at all, then you should drop and then add Math 53. A swap would be a good option if you were in Math 54, but would rather be in Math 53. If you weren't able to get into Math 53, you would remain in Math 54. So if you have no intentions of taking Math 54, you should drop so you don't accidentally end up staying enrolled.

How do swaps work? I am accidentally enrolled in MATH54 this semester and should actually be in MATH53. So looking to swap those two- is that the correct thing to do, or should I drop the class I don’t want and add the one I do want? Clarify “swaps” for me if possible!

history.content:
This is a reminder of upcoming add/drop deadlines for Fall 2020.

Deadline to Add/Drop without Late fees

Class Drop Deadline without a late fee is 9/4/20 at 11:59 PM

Class Add Deadline without a late fee is 9/11/20 at 11:59 PM

Swap Deadlines

Undergraduate Deadline to Add/Drop/Swap/Change Units is 9/16/20 at 11:59PM.

Swap actions are adds and drops. Late add/drop fees will apply to swaps.

history.content:
This is a reminder of upcoming add/drop deadlines for Fall 2020.

Early Drop Deadline

If a student is attempting to drop or swap out of the following classes with an Early Drop Deadline, the student must request approval from their College to drop the class if the deadline of Friday, 9/4/20 at 11:59 PM has passed.

Deadline to Add/Drop without Late fees

Class Drop Deadline without a late fee is 9/4/20 at 11:59 PM

Class Add Deadline without a late fee is 9/11/20 at 11:59 PM

Swap Deadlines

Undergraduate Deadline to Add/Drop/Swap/Change Units is 9/16/20 at 11:59PM.

Swap actions are adds and drops. Late add/drop fees will apply to swaps.
